scenarios.label: Baseline / Recommended
scenarios.description: Production-ready web app using Azure App Service (approx B2), Azure SQL DB (approx S1), Redis cache for session state, and Blob storage for uploads with essential security, monitoring, and backup.

resources.notes: Single production VNet for App Service integration, private endpoints for SQL, Redis, and Storage. No direct VNet cost but needed for topology.
Basic B2 App Service plan hosting a single production web app. Assumes moderate traffic and 24x7 operation. Egress_gb approximates outbound web responses.
resources.product_name: Azure App Service Basic Plan - Linux

sku_candidates.product_name: Azure App Service Basic Plan - Linux
Azure App Service Basic Plan - Linux

resources.notes: Single Azure SQL Database in Standard S1 tier as requested. 100 GB storage assumed. DTU model with 20 DTUs. Egress for occasional data export.
Standard C1 Redis cache for session state and output caching. Throughput and operations sized for moderate web traffic.
General-purpose v2 storage account with Blob storage for user uploads. Mix of Hot and Cool tiers, GRS for durability. Egress for file downloads.
resources.meter_name: Hot Data Returned for Query Acceleration, Cool Data Scanned for Query Acceleration
resources.product_name: Azure Data Lake Storage Gen2 Hierarchical Namespace, Azure Data Lake Storage Gen2 Hierarchical Namespace

sku_candidates.meter_name: Hot Data Returned for Query Acceleration
sku_candidates.product_name: Azure Data Lake Storage Gen2 Hierarchical Namespace

sku_candidates.meter_name: Cool Data Scanned for Query Acceleration
sku_candidates.product_name: Azure Data Lake Storage Gen2 Hierarchical Namespace

resources.notes: Application Gateway v2 with WAF for HTTPS termination and protection in front of App Service. Egress approximates outbound traffic to clients.
Standard public IP for Application Gateway endpoint.
NAT gateway for controlled outbound internet access from integrated services (e.g., App Service VNet integration). Egress for external API calls and updates.
resources.meter_name: Standard Inter-Availability Zone Data Transfer Out

sku_candidates.meter_name: Standard Inter-Availability Zone Data Transfer Out

resources.notes: Key Vault for connection strings, secrets, and certificates used by App Service and other components. Standard tier with moderate operations.
Central Log Analytics workspace for App Service, SQL diagnostics, Redis metrics, and Activity Logs. 200 GB/month ingestion with some data archived.
Recovery Services vault for Azure SQL DB long-term backup and configuration backups. 250 GB backup storage assumed.
resources.meter_name: ADLS Gen2 Vaulted LRS Write Operations

sku_candidates.meter_name: ADLS Gen2 Vaulted LRS Write Operations
ADLS Gen2 Vaulted ZRS Write Operations
ADLS Gen2 Vaulted RA-GRS Write Operations
ADLS Gen2 Vaulted GRS Write Operations

resources.notes: Placeholder for DR protection of critical components where applicable (e.g., configuration, potential future IaaS). One protected instance assumed for costing; Azure SQL DB uses built-in geo-replication rather than ASR.

scenarios.label: Cost Optimized
scenarios.description: Lower-cost variant with smaller tiers, reduced redundancy, and fewer advanced network components while keeping the same logical architecture.

resources.notes: Same logical VNet as baseline; no direct cost.
Smaller Basic B1 App Service plan for lower traffic. Still 24x7 but with reduced capacity.
resources.product_name: Azure App Service Basic Plan - Linux

sku_candidates.product_name: Azure App Service Basic Plan - Linux
Azure App Service Basic Plan - Linux

resources.notes: Azure SQL Database Basic tier for small workloads and dev-like production. Lower DTUs and storage than S1.
Basic B0 Redis cache for light session state usage. No SLA and no replication but cheaper.
Blob storage with LRS instead of GRS to reduce cost. Slightly lower capacity and egress than baseline.
resources.meter_name: Hot Data Returned for Query Acceleration, Cool Data Scanned for Query Acceleration

resources.notes: Represents direct internet exposure via App Service (no Application Gateway/WAF). Basic IP-level costing approximation.
Generic outbound data transfer for web responses and file downloads when not using NAT/Application Gateway.
resources.meter_name: Standard Inter-Availability Zone Data Transfer Out

sku_candidates.meter_name: Standard Inter-Availability Zone Data Transfer Out

resources.notes: Key Vault retained but with lower expected usage.
Reduced ingestion and retention to lower monitoring costs.
Smaller backup footprint and potentially shorter retention.

scenarios.label: High Performance / Scalable
scenarios.description: Higher-capacity App Service, more powerful Azure SQL tier, larger Redis cache, and more robust storage and networking for heavier traffic and stricter SLAs.

resources.notes: VNet with subnets for Application Gateway, integration, and private endpoints. No direct cost.
Premium v2 P1 App Service plan with 2 instances for higher throughput, autoscale, and better SLA. Egress sized for heavier traffic.
resources.product_name: Azure App Service Premium v3 Plan - Linux

sku_candidates.product_name: Azure App Service Premium v3 Plan - Linux
Azure App Service Premium v4 Plan - Linux
Azure App Service Premium v2 Plan - Linux
Azure App Service Premium v4 Plan
Azure App Service Premium v3 Plan

resources.notes: Azure SQL Database S2 DTU tier for more CPU/IO and larger database size. Suitable for higher concurrent load.
Premium P1 Redis cache with better performance, persistence options, and higher throughput for intensive session and caching workloads.
Blob storage with GZRS for higher availability and durability. Larger capacity and egress for heavy upload/download scenarios.

resources.notes: Application Gateway WAF v2 with higher throughput assumptions and autoscaling for heavy traffic.
Standard public IP for high-performance Application Gateway.
NAT gateway sized for higher outbound traffic to external APIs and services.
resources.meter_name: Standard Inter-Availability Zone Data Transfer Out

sku_candidates.meter_name: Standard Inter-Availability Zone Data Transfer Out

resources.notes: Premium Key Vault for higher security and potential HSM-backed keys, with more operations.
Higher ingestion and longer retention for detailed observability and analytics.
Larger backup storage for longer retention and more frequent backups of databases and configurations.
